com.freshbourne.io
Class ResourceHeader

java.lang.Object
  com.freshbourne.io.AbstractMustInitializeOrLoad
      com.freshbourne.io.ResourceHeader
All Implemented Interfaces:
MustInitializeOrLoad
public class ResourceHeader
extends AbstractMustInitializeOrLoad

organizes the underlying byte[] like this: HEADER: PAGESIZE | LAST_ID | NUM_OF_FREED_PAGES | FREE_PAGE_1 | FREE_PAGE_ Page Zero is reserved for the header.

public void initialize()
Description copied from interface: MustInitializeOrLoad
Since this is an extremely generic interface, some implementations might throw an IOException, some might not. Just be be sure, the interface specifies the Exception. In the documentation of you implementation it can be specified that this Exception is never thrown.
